name: Andama Bread
directions:
Mix:
5 c. flour 
1 c. cornmeal
2 pkgs dry yeast
1 T. salt

Now mix in a separate bowl:
2 c. hot water 
1/2 c. molasses
5 T. margarine 

Add water/molasses mixture to flour mixture and blend well. Knead, and let rise for 1-2 hours until doubled. Place in loaf pans and let rise again until doubled --- 1 hour. Bake in 375 oven for 40-50 until brown ed and sound hollow on the top.

Makes 2 loaves

name: Anderson's Pea Soup
directions:
Recipe for 8 bowls of Anderson's Famous Split Pea soup:

2 Qts. of soft water
2 Cups of green split peas
1 branch of celery coarsely chopped
1 large carrot, chopped
1 small onion, chopped
1/4 teaspoon of ground thyme
1 pinch of cayenne
1 bayleaf
3/4 t. salt
pepper

Boil hard for 20 minutes then slowly strain through fine sieve slowly until peas are tender and reheat to boiling point.

name: Apple John
directions:
Sprinkle peeled apples with cinnamon and sugar.

Mix 1 cup sugar (half-shite and half brown. is good) and 1/2 cup butter. Add 1 cup flour. Sprinkle over apples.

Bake 30 minutes at 325 or until brown on top.

name: Baked Fish with Sour Cream
directions:
1-1 1/2 lbs. steaks or fillets of any white fish (halibut, rock cod, sole, butterfish, flounder, etc.).
1/2 c. sour cream med. onion, chopped fine
1/4 c. parsley
1/2 c. white wine
1/2 t. salt
pepper, if desired

Place fish in buttered baking dish. Mix sour cream, salt pepper and onions together and spread over fish. Garnish with lemon slices. Add the wine, place in 350 oven for 30-40 minutes until fish flakes easily with a fork. Do not over-cook.

name: Banana Walnut Bread
directions:
1 c. sugar
1/2 c. butter or margarine.
2 eggs
1 1/3 c. mashed bananas
2 c. sifted flour
1 t. baking powder
1/2 t. salt
3/4 c. chopped walnuts

Cream butter and sugar. Add eggs and mashed bananas. Sift together flour, soda and salt. Add to mixture along with walnuts. Pour into greased 9x5 inch baking pan. Bake 1 hour. in 375 degree oven.

name: Basic Cheese Dip
directions:
1/4 c. milk
8 oz. cottage cheese. 
6 oz. cream cheese
2 oz. blue cheese

Add and blend.

1 clove garlic 
few drops tabasco

name: Beef Dip
directions: Set oven at 500 degrees. Place beef uncovered in pan in oven for 45 minutes. Then add 1 can of consommé and 1 can of water and cover whole pan with aluminum foil. Turn off oven and let stand for 1 1/2 hours. (Use watermelon cut or any other cut that is not fatty and can be oven-roasted, about 3½ to 4½ pounds.)

name: Beet Soup
directions:
5 medium beets 
2 1/2 c. water
1 1/2 t dill weed 
3 T lemon juice 
1 c. diced cucumber 

Cook or steam beets in their skins until fork tender. Salt lightly while cooking. slip skins and put beets in a blender or food processor with the water lemon juice and dill. Puree until smooth; cool "then chill well. Serve garnished with cucumber. Serves 4

name: Brilliant Bran Muffins
directions:
Soak-1 cup 100% bran in 1 cup boiling water

1 1/2 cup sugar 
2 eggs
2 1/2 cup flour 
1/2 tsp. soda
1/2 cup raisins, if desired
1/2 cup salad oil
2 cups buttermilk.
1/2 tsp. salt
2 1/2 cup Kellogg’s All-Bran

Mix all. Bake at 400 20 minutes. Batter will keep in the refrigerator for 3 weeks.

name: Broccoli Parmesan
directions:
1 pkg. frozen broccoli spears
1/2 c. butter 
1/4 c. dry Vermouth (or dry white table wine, but preferably Vermouth)
2 t. lemon juice.
2 T. chopped parsley

Grated parmesan cheese, paprika While broccoli cooks, combine next four ingredients in saucepan; heat slowly until butter melts. Lift cooked broccoli onto heated plates. Spoon hot butter-wine sauce over each serving. Sprinkle parmesan and dust w/ paprika.

Serve at once.

name: Butterballs
directions:
1 c. butter
1/2 c. powdered sugar 
2 1/2 c. sifted flour
1/4 t. salt
3/4 c. finely chopped pecans
1 t. vanilla 

Add all ingredients in order as listed. Mix dough until forms a ball by hand-

Form into 1-inch balls. Bake in moderate oven 350 for 15 to 17 minutes. While hot roll in powdered sugar---Cool and roll again. 

P.S. I put powdered sugar in a bag and put in butterballs and shake.

makes 4 dozen

name: Carrot Walnut Bread
directions:
1 cup oil
3/4 cup sugar
2 eggs
1 tsp. vanilla
1 1/2 c. sifted flour
1 1/2 tsp. baking soda
1 1/2 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 tsp. salt
1 1/2 c. grated carrot (3 large) 
1 1/2 c. ground walnuts

lemon glaze (recipe follows)

Grease 9x5 inch pan. Dust lightly with flour; tap out any excess. Combine oil, sugar, eggs, and vanilla in a large bowl. Sift together dry ingredients. Add to sugar mixture. Stir in carrots and walnuts. Fix just til blended. Turn into prepared pan. Bake in 350 I oven for 1 hour, or until center springs back when lightly pressed with fingertip. Cool in pan 10 minutes. Turn onto wire rack. Top with lemon glare.

Glaze: Combine 1/2 c. powdered sugar, 1 tsp. grated lemon rind and 1 T. lemon juice in a small bowl. Stir until smooth. Drizzle over top and sides of the loaf.

name: Celery and Lime Soup
directions:
4 C. chopped celery with leaves 
1 1/2 C chopped onion 
1/2 C. brown rice 
1/2 C. chopped parsley 
4 C water 
1 T. dill weed 
1 t. salt 
4 eggs 
1/3 c. lime juice
sour cream
minced parsley
 
Put celery, onion, rice, in parsley, water, dill and salt in a soup pot. Bring to a boil. reduce heat, cover and simmer until rice is tender, about 35 to 40 minutes. Beat eggs until frothy, then slowly beat in lime juice. Add 2 cups of the pureed soup to the egg mixture, pouring continually and beating very slowly so that the eggs will not curdle. Return mixture to pot and cook and stir over low heat until slightly thickened. Do not allow to boil Remove from heat, cool, then chill for at least 5 hours Serve garnished with sour cream and parsley. Serves 6.

name: Chawoof
directions:
1 piece fatback
4 c. water
1 pint chawoof
1 potato, cubed

Cook fatback about 1/2 hour. Slice or cube fatback about 2 pieces size of walnut or more. Add potatoes cubed and cock 1/2 hour. (or til done.)  Then add chawoof and boil 10 minutes. Add sour cream just before eating. You can put it in your soup dish just before eating if you don't want to put it all in the soup. Make sure you don't boil sour cream the next day. It will curdle. Just heat it slowly. (You can make it in 1 hour.)

name: Cheese Popovers
directions: Beat together with rotary beater 2 eggs and 1 cup milk. sift flour, measure 1 cup, and sift again with 1/2 tsp. salt in milk mixture. Beat until smooth Divide 1/2 cup shredded sharp Cheddar or Swiss cheese into 6 portions, placing each in bottom of well-greased custard cup, deep muffin tin, or popover pan. Pour 1/6 of the batter into each cup, over cheese. Bake in a hot oven (425) for 35 minutes. or until puffed and golden brown Serve immediately. Makes 6 popovers

name: Chili Casserole
directions:
3/4 lb. Monterey Jack Cheese 3/4 lb. Cheddar cheese
2 large cans Chili Ortega
2 eggs
2 ribs
2 T. flour 
1 small can evaporated milk
pinch of salt

Sauce:
1 small can tomato sauce 
1 can Chili Salsa Verde

In 2 qt Pyrex, layer sliced Ortega chilis from one can; then half the cheeses shredded and mixed together. Repeat these layers. Peat the 2 eggs with the flour and salt and evaporated milk and pour over the chilis and cheese layers. Fake uncovered in a 350 oven for 30 minutes. Then if you like, pour the tomato sauce over it and bake for 15 more minutes. (The sauce can also be served alongside the dish.)

name: Chinese Almond Cookies
directions:
2 3/4 cups sifted all-purpose flour
1 cup sugar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon soda
1 cup butter, margarine, or lard
1 slightly beaten egg
1 teaspoon almond extract 
1/3 cup whole unblanched almonds

Sift together flour, sugar, salt, and soda; cut in butter, margarine, or lard till mixture resembles cornmeal. Add egg and almond extract; mix well. Shape dough into 1-inch balls and place, 2 inches apart, on ungreased cookie sheet. Place an almond atop each cookie and press down to flatten slightly. Bake in slow oven (325 degrees) 15 to 18 minutes. Cool on rack. Makes about 4 dozen cookies.

name: Chocolate Cookies
directions:
1/2 cup butter
1 cup sugar 

Cream the above together

2 eggs beaten together
2 squares melted chocolate.
1/2 tsp. vanilla
pinch salt 
2/3 cup flour

Mix everything above thoroughly.

Drop by teaspoons on buttered and floured sheet. Bake at 275, until slightly firm on the top. (10 + minutes). Allow to cool just a bit before removing. (May add an almond or walnut to each before baking)

name: Chocolate Frosting
directions:
4 Tb. butter
4 oz. chocolate
1/3 cup hot milk
3 cups sifted confectioners' sugar 
1 t. vanilla
1/8 teaspoon salt

Melt butter & chocolate; blend; Stir hot mild into sugar & beat until smooth. Stir in vanilla, salt, and chocolate. Beat until smooth and thickened. (About 5 minutes.)

Frosts 2 9" cake layers.

name: Chocolate Waldorf Cake
directions:
1 cup sugar
2 cups plain flour,
4 level tablespoons cocoa 
2 level teaspoons baking soda
Pinch of salt
1 cup cold water
1 teaspoon vanilla
1 cup mayonnaise
2 heaping tablespoons seedless blackberry jam

Sift sugar, flour, cocoa, soda & salt together. Add mayo, water, vanilla, jam.

name: Cpvapcici (Serbian Hamburger Rolls)
directions:
1/3 lb. each veal and lamb 
1 lb. lean beef
2 onions
1/2 tsp. baking soda salt and pepper to taste

Grind beef, veal and lamb together with baking soda. Fix with salt and pepper--- working well with hands. Form into sausage inch long. Broil on grate over hot charcoal fire or very hot skillet. Turn gently several times. Chop raw onions fine. Place sausage on warm plate. Sprinkle with chopped onions.

Serve with rolls if you care to.

name: Cranberry Pudding
directions:
Sift:
1 1/2 cups flour
1 teaspoon salt
1 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda

Pour boiling water into a measuring cup containing 1/2 cup molasses until overflows into flour. Stir water and molasses together and into flour. Add and mix 1 1/2 cups cranberries. Turn into a greased mold and cover. Steam for 2 1/2 hours.

Sauce:
1 cup sugar
1/2 cup butter
1 cup cream
-- in double boiler for 1 hour.

name: Cucumber Dill Ladyfingers
directions:
1 loaf "party" pumpernickel rye bread
1 bucket of fresh cream cheese
bunch of dill cucumbers 

Spread cream cheese on bread, then place thin sliced* cucumber on top-- sprinkle a few sprigs of dill on top.

Keep refrigerated.

*Not too thick not too thin

name: Date Nut Bread
directions:
2 c. sifted flour
1 c. brown sugar (packed)
2 eggs
1/2 c. butter (1 stick margarine)
1 t. soda. 
1/2 c. sour milk
1/4 t. salt
1 t. vanilla
1 t. lemon juice 
1 c. chopped dates 
1 c. chopped nuts

Bake at 350 for 14 hours.

name: Favorite Baked Custard
directions:
1 teaspoon vanilla or other flavoring
6 eggs, slightly beaten
1/2 cup sugar
1/4 t. salt
1 quart milk, scalded
Cinnamon or nutmeg

Blend the first 4 ingredients; strain into the milk; mix well. Pour into 6 or 8 greased custard cups or a baking dish. Set in a pan of hot water with the water coming as high on the outside of the containers as the custard is on the inside. Sprinkle with cinnamon or nutmeg, if desired, and bake in a moderate oven (350 degrees) until a knife inserted comes out clean. Allow about 45 minutes for custard cups, and about 1 hour for a baking dish.

name: Fluffy Pancakes
directions:
1 egg
3/4 c. milk
2 T. shortening
1 c. flour
1/2 t. salt
2 T. baking powder
2 T. sugar

Combine egg, shortening and milk. Add dry ingredients. Fry in batter.

name: Fondue
directions:
1. Grate cheese

2. Put 4 level teaspoons flour in pot.

3. Put 4, half glasses wine in pot.

4. Sprinkle garlic salt, pepper and salt (8 sprinkles garlic salt, 4 each of salt and pepper)

5. Put pot on single red heat

6. When brew begins to bubble, add cheese, handful at a time. until each melts.

7. Stir slowly

8. When cheese is melted and smooth and begins to bubble, add 4 tablespoons kirsch stir and serve in a few minutes.

Serves 4

name: French Dressing (Sauce Vinaigrette)
directions:
1 teaspoon chopped onion
1 teaspoon chopped chives
1 teaspoon chopped parsley
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon freshly ground black pepper
2 tablespoons wine vinegar
4 tablespoons olive oil

Mix all the seasonings with the vinegar and allow them to stand several minutes before combining with the oil. Mix thoroughly before serving.

name: French Sponge Cake
directions:
6 eggs -- beat well 
1 1/2 cups flour
4 tsp. baking powder 
1 1/2 c. sugar
pinch salt

Mix dry ingredients Beat eggs till really fluffy about 5 minutes. Add dry ingredients slowly and beat well. Add flavoring and beat. Bake at 325 for 45 minutes in a 10x13 pan or tube.

or 1/2 recipe serves 9 pieces -- 8or 9" --

name: Friendship Soup
directions:
2 carrots, washed and sliced 
1 stalk celery 
1 small onion, peeled and chopped 
2 stems of parsley, chopped 
2 medium potatoes, peeled and chopped 
1 cup canned tomatoes 
3 cups water 
2 bouillon cubes
3/4 teaspoon salt
2 hot dogs, sliced

Put everything into the pot, let it cook;stir; turn heat down to low--let simmer, about 1 hour. Makes 5 cups--serve with crackers,

name: Ginger Snaps
directions:
1-1/2 cups softened butter
4 cups flour
4 tsp. baking soda
2 cups sugar
2 eggs
2 tsp. ginger
2 tsp. cinnamon
1/2 cup molasses
2 tsp. cloves
pinch of salt

Roll the dough into 1-inch balls and roll in sugar.
Place on greased cookie sheet and bake at 350' for 12 minutes.

name: Gram's Dried Mushroom Soup
directions:
1/2 or 1 lb. marrow beans (soak overnight)
1 onion (whole)
1 bay leaf
3 Parsley roots--(maybe parsnips-cut in half)
2 T or so dried dill
2 T parsley--green chopped
Dried Mushrooms (soak overnight)
3 or 4 potatoes cubed

Brown together,
1/4 c oil
1/4 medium onion
5 or 6T. vinegar

Put beans, water, onion, parsley and parsley roots, dried mushrooms, bay leaf, salt and pepper. Don't know how many mushrooms--judge for yourself about a pint or so

Cook about 3 hours until mushrooms are done. Add potatoes.Cook until done. Add vinegar. Cool
Bring to a boil.

Now brown 1/4 onion in oil. Add to cooked soup. Pat luke warm.

name: Gram's Nut Bread
directions:
2 c. scalded milk 
1/2 c. butter
1/2 c. sugar
1 t. salt
2pkgs. dry yeast or 2 small cakes 
4 eggs beaten 
8 c. flour (or 9 cups -- must be a soft dough)

Dissolve yeast in cup of cooled milk. Put shortening into milk while hot. Add sugar and beaten eggs when cooled.

Add flour and salt--Knead well. After you add flour. 
Cover and let rise (double), Divide dough into 4 parts. Poll out into a rectangle (10″ x12") or so with rolling pin.

Put nut filling 1/4 inch thick on dough and roll up into a roll. Put on cookie sheet===Brush with beaten egg yolk and 1 T water.

Let raise double Bake at 350 for 35 -40 minutes.

Makes 4 rolls.

name: Gram's Nut Filling
directions:
2 c. milk 
5-6 cups nut meats (ground fine in blender)---1 lb. nuts 
1 c. sugar (1/2 white and 1/2 brown)
1/2 c. honey 
1/2 c. cracker crumbs
2 eggs--beaten.
1/4 c. butter 
1/2 t. cinnamon.

Cook nuts milk, cracker crumbs, sugar and honey till thick. Stir. about 10 minutes. Add eggs; (beaten) and cinnamon-Cook 5 minutes and stir.

Cool and spread on rolled dough about inch. Roll up and put on cookie sheet. Cover with tea towel to raise so dough won't dry. Bake 2 Or 3 rolls on a cookie sheet. Bake 350 35-40 minutes. Makes 4 rolls 12 inches long.

Nut filling: should be soft like oatmeal. Add milk if too thick and hard.

name: Gram's Pizza Dough
directions:
2 cups flour 
1 cup warm water 
+ 1 tsp. sugar 
+ 1 package yeast

flour mixture: 
mix flour 
+ 2 T. oil  
+ a little salt

Let yeast stand for 5 minutes, then mix with the flour mixture. Let sit for 40 minutes. Place on a pizza pan and dry at 400 for 5 minutes.

Add your own toppings and sauce.

name: Guacamole
directions:
2 avocados 
2 T. lemon juice 
2 T. minced mild onion 
2 T. tomato, chopped

and hot pepper sauce, 1 small hot red pepper or 6 little green peppers

1/2 tsp. salt

Rub bowl with garlic. Mush and serve.

name: Humus
directions:
1 lb. garbanzo beans.
1/2 cup tahini (after you've made it!)*
garlic 
lemon juice 
salt
black pepper
parsley flakes

Put the garbanzo beans during all night in a big bowl of water. Rinse the beans and cook in water for 4 hours until the beans are very soft. Crush it or use a blender, add the tahini, garlic, slat lemon juice, black pepper, parsley. I after all it's too thick add some water. 

Use pita bread, hot sauce and some pickles and fresh onions for the best taste.

*Don't buy ready tahini but the one that you have to make by yourself.

name: Hungarian Pork Chops
directions:
4-6 pork chops cut 1-1 1/2" thick 
salt and pepper
Flour
1/2 c. dairy sour cream
1/3 c. dry or medium sherry
1/4 c. catsup
1/2 t. Worcestershire sauce
1/4 t. paprika 

Sprinkle pork chops w/ salt and pepper; dredge w/ flour. Brown slowly on both sides in skillet in a little oil. Pour off any excess fat. Mix remaining ingredients; add salt and pepper to taste; pour over chops, Cover and simmer gently one hour turning and basting chops occasionally.

name: Ice Cream Sandwich Cookies
directions:
2 3/4 c. flour
1/2 c. unsweetened cocoa powder. 
2 1/2 t. baking powder
1/4 tsp salt
12 T unsalted butter (soft)
1 1/2 tsp. vanilla 
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs 
1 T. milk

Dry ingred. together. Cream butt, sugar, vanilla Add-eggs & milk. Add day. Dough 2 feat. disks-plastic wrap-chill 1 hr.

Preheat oven 350⁰. Boll dough 1.8" thick. Cut for pairs. Place on parchment chill 30 mins. on sheet Prick up holes. Bake 12-15 mins. Cool.

Put ice cream in, direct to freezer. Keep stored in airtight container 3-4 days.

Vanilla extract:
2 whole beans, split lengthwise 
8oz vodka
Jar in dark cupboard 2-5 month. Shake occasionally.

name: Icy Banana Shake
directions:
3 ice cubes
3/4 cup milk
1 T. sugar
1/2 t. vanilla
1 ripe banana

Blend in blender. Drink!

name: Indian Fried Chicken
directions:
1/2 t. paprika
1/4 turmeric
1/4 t. cayenne pepper
1/4 t. black pepper 
1/8 t. ground cinnamon

1 t. salt
1 frying chicken, disjointed 
1/4 cup vegetable oil or clarified butter

Combine paprika, turmeric, cayenne pepper, black pepper, cinnamon and salt. Rub this mixture into the chicken parts.

Heat oil or butter and sauté the chicken until very tender.

name: Kitchen Sink Barbeque Sauce for Chicken
directions:
Catsup (almost the bulk of the sauce is catsup)

Add
some Worcestershire Sauce
lemon juice
honey or molasses 
oil (Mazola) to keep skin moist

and anything else goes:

mustard 
something sharper--Cayenne
A-1 sauce and/or Soya sauce 
juice from canned fruit

Keep from thinning too much. Coat chicken pieces!

name: Lace Cookie
directions:
1 cup oatmeal
1 cup brown sugar.
1/2 cup butter
pinch salt
1 tsp. vanilla
1/8 tsp. soda
1 tsp. water

Tix and let stand in refrigerator. Fake little balls about 1" in diameter. Space well, Bake in 250-350 oven for 8-10 minutes. Let cool for about 2 minutes and loosen with spatula You may roll around handle of wooden spoon (but I can't)

50 cookies

name: Lamb Burgers
directions:
1/2 lb. lamb
1/2 t. garlic salt
1/2 C. chopped gr. onions and some tops
4 T. cocktail sherry
1 t. salt
1/2 t. oregano

Mix thoroughly. Broil 5 minutes each side.

name: Lamb Indad
directions:
3 T. veg. oil
1 1/2 lb. lamb or beef, cubed 
1 lg. onion, finely chopped
1/4 t. ginger, finely chopped
1/4 t. crushed red pepper 
3 cloves garlic, crushed
1 c. water
4 cloves
1 t. paprika
1/4 t. turmeric
2 T. vinegar
1 t. salt
1/2 t. cumin 
2 in. stick of cinnamon.

Heat veg. oil and brown lamb cubes. Remove and set aside. Put in chopped onion and brown it. Add cloves, paprika, turmeric, cumin, cinnamon, ginger crushed red pepper and garlic. Fry for 2 or 3 minutes. Put in browned lamb cubes, water, vinegar, and salt. Simmer until lamb is tender, about 1 hour.

name: Lamb Parmesan
directions:
1 boned leg of lamb (about 5 pounds)
1/3 cup flour
1/3 cup olive oil
2 cloves garlic, crushed
1 can (10 1/2 oz.) mushroom soup
1 can (8 oz.) tomato sauce
2 cups Marsala wine (1 1/2) 
2 tablespoons commercial sour cream
1 onion, sliced very fine
1 cup fresh mushrooms (whole)
1 tablespoon chicken stock base or 2 bouillon cubes
2 teaspoons salt (3/4)
3/4 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon marjoram 
Parmesan cheese

Cut meat into 1/4-inch slices, trimming off fat as you go. Lightly. dip in flour, then brown in olive oil heated with 1 clove of the garlic. Place in large casserole. In another pan or bowl, combine all remaining ingredients except Parmesan cheese. Blend well and pour over lamb. Sprinkle with Parmesan cheese and bake in moderate oven (350 degrees) for 1 hour, stirring twice. Serve over steamed rice, pilaf, or wild rice. Serves 6 to 8

name: Lemon Frosting
directions:
2 and 3/4 cup confectioner's sugar
2 tsp. salt 
1 egg
1 T. lite corn syrup cup shortening
1 tsp. vanilla
2 T. lemon juice 
1 T. grated lemon peel

Mix confec. sugar, salt, and egg. Blend in syrup. Add shortening, vanilla, lemon juice, and peel. Mix until smooth and creamy. Add more sugar to thicken or water to thin if required until it is of spreading consistency.

name: Lemon Meringue Pie
directions:
1 c. gran. sugar
1/4 t. salt
1/4 c. flour
3 T. butter 
1/4 c. lemon juice.
grated rind 1 lemon
2 c. water
2 T. cornstarch
3 eggs, separated
baked 9-inch pie shell
meringue pie topping

1. combine sugar, salt, flour, and cornstarch and gradually stir in water. Cook stirring constantly until thickened and smooth.
2. Gradually stir hot mixture into beaten egg yolks, return to low heat and cook. Stirring two minutes. Reserve white for meringue. Stir in butter lemon juice and rind and cool slightly. Pour into baked pastry shell and cool top with meringue and brown in oven. as directed.

3 egg white 
1/4 t. cream of tar.
6 T. sugar

1. beat egg whites until light and frothy. add c. of t. and continue until whites are stiff enough to hold a peak.
2. gradually beat sugar in and beat until meringue is stiff and glossy.

name: Lemon Roasted Oregano Chicken
directions:
2/3 cup butter, melted
1 clove garlic / garlic salt - 4 shakes
2 capfuls of lemon juice
3 pinches of oregano 
a shake each of salt and pepper

Melt all of these things together in a pot on med/low heat.
Put 3 chicken half-breasts and 6 thighs on a broiler pan. Spread some of the sauce over chicken (If you need more later, make more!) Broil for 10 minutes; Baste. Baste every ten minutes.

name: Lisa Cake
directions:
1 box cake
1 box instant pudding
1 cup milk 
1/2 cup oil
4 eggs

Put all of the above in large bowl. Mix for 10 minutes. Put on round spring tube pan(buttered). Bake for 45-50 minutes at 325.

Test, if not done bake for 5 more minutes.

* If making orange cake replace milk with orange juice
* Use chocolate cake with choc. pudding. Use vanilla cake. and vanilla pudding with orange.
* Lemon pudding -- lemon mix.

name: Marinade for Salmon
directions:
3/4 c. dry vermouth
3/4 c olive oil,
1 1/2 T. lemon juice
3/4 t. salt/pepper
1/4 t. thyme 
1/4 t. marjoram
1/8 t. sage
1 T. minced parsley

Mix and put over salmon-charcoal -greased until brown. 15 min.
3/4 inch thick

name: Meat Loaf
directions:
2 pounds ground beef
3/4 cup milk 
1 1/2 cups soft bread crumbs 
2 teaspoons salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper

1 medium carrot grated
1 small onion diced
2 eggs slightly beaten
1/4 cup catsup.
3 tablespoons brown sugar 
2 tablespoons prepared mustard

Pour milk over breadcrumbs. Add ground beef, salt, pepper, carrot, onion and eggs.
Mix thoroughly. Pack in a 9x5 loaf pan or shape into a loaf 9x5. Mix together catsup, brown sugar and mustard. Spread mixture on meatloaf. Bake in a slow oven (300 degrees) 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours.

Serves 8.

name: Mediterrananean Bread
directions:
Proof 1 pkgs yeast with 1 T. sugar in 2 c. warm water.

In large bowl combine
5 c. flour
1 T. salt

Add the yeast mixture and knead. Let dough double in bulk (1 1/2 hrs)

Punch and divide dough. Slash the dough and form into loaves. Cover and let rise for5 minutes. Brush with mixture of water and egg white and put in a cold oven set to 400. Bake loaves 35-45 minutes until they sound hollow when tapped.

Makes 2 loaves

name: Mom's Cookies
directions:
2 c. sugar 
4 1/2 c. flour
1 t. baking powder
1 t. baking soda 
1 c. butter or marg.
1 c. sour cream 
2 eggs
juice of 1 orange

Confec. sugar and lemon juice for topping. Spread on cookies while hot. Bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes.

name: Mom's Meat Loaf
directions:
2 lb. gr. meat
3/4 cup milk
1 1/2 c. soft breadcrumbs
2 t. salt
1/8 tsp.
1 med. carrot grated 
1 small onion diced
2 eggs slightly beaten 
1/4 c. catsup
3 T. brown sugar 
2 T. prepared mustard

Pour milk over breadcrumbs. Add ground beef, salt, carrot, onion, and eggs. Mix thoroughly. Pack in a 9x5 inch loaf pan or shape into a loaf 9 x 5. Mix together catsup, brown sugar and mustard. Spread mixture. on meat loaf. Bake in a slow oven (300) for 1 1/2 to 1 3/4 hours.

serves 8

name: Moussaka a la Greque
directions:
3 med. sized eggplants
1 c. butter 
3 large onions, chopped
2 lb. gr. lamb or beef 
3 T. tomato paste
1/2 c. red wine
1/2 c. chopped parsley.
1/4 t. cinnamon 
salt to taste

fresh gr. pepper to taste 
6 T. flour
1 qt. milk
4 eggs, beaten frothy
nutmeg 
2 c. ricotta cheese or cottage cheese
1 c. fine breadcrumbs 
1 c. freshly grated parmesan cheese

1. peel eggplants and cut them into slices in. thick. Brown slices quickly in 4 T. butter, set aside.

 2. Heat 4 T. butter in same skillet and cook onions. until brown. Add gr. meat and cook for ten minutes. Combine the tomato paste with wine, parsley, cinnamon, and salt and pepper. Stir mixture into meat and simmer. over low heat, stirring, frequently until all liquid has been absorbed. Remove mixture from fire. 

3. Preheat oven to 375.

4. Make a white sauce by melting 8 T. butter and blending in the flour, stirring with whisk Meanwhile, bring milk to boil and add it gradually to butter-flour mixture, stirring constantly. When mixture is thickened and smooth, remove it from heat. Cool slightly and stir in beaten eggs and ricotta cheese. 

5. Grease 11 x 16 pan. and sprinkle the bottom lightly with breadcrumbs. Arrange alternate layers of eggplant and meat sauce in pan, sprinkling each layer with parmesan cheese and breadcrumbs. Pour ricotta cheese sauce over top and bake one hour, or until top is golden. Remove from oven and cool 20 to 30 minutes before serving. Cut into squares and serve.

Note: flavor of this dish improves on standing-for one day. Reheat before serving.

name: Murgh Marsala (Spicy Chicken)
directions:
1 fryer, disjointed
1 large clove garlic.
2 t. cumin
2 t. turmeric 
1/4 t. cayenne pepper
2 T. ground coriander. 
3 whole cardamoms 
6 cloves 
1/4 c. clarified butter 
1 t. salt
1 inch piece of ginger
2-inch stick of cinnamon
4 large tomatoes, chopped

In a food mill or electric blender, grind together the onion, garlic, coriander, cumin, turmeric, cayenne pepper, cardamoms, cloves, ginger and cinnamon. Rub this poste into the chicken parts.
Heat the butter and sauté the chicken for 10 minutes. Add salt and tomatoes. Cover tightly and simmer until chicken is tender and sauce is very thick.

name: Nobby Apple Cake
directions:
8x8x2 350° - 40 minutes
3 T margarine 
1 cup sugar
1 beaten egg
1/2 t. Cinnamon
1/4 t. nutmeg + salt
1 1/4 c. flour / 1 t. Soda
3 cups diced apples
1 t. vanilla.

Cream butter & sugar. - add egg - add flour + spices. Stir in apples + vanilla. BAKE

name: Oatmeal Muffins
directions:
Soak together for 1 hour: 
1 cup rolled oats 
1 cup buttermilk or sour milk

Mix thoroughly:

1/3 cup shortening (part butter) 
1/2 cup brown sugar (packed)
1 egg

Sift together:
1 cup flour 
1 tsp. baking powder
3 tsp. soda 
1 tsp. salt

Stir into shortening mixture. Alternatively add rolled oats and buttermilk. Then fill the greased muffin cups 2/3 full. Bake at 400 for 20-25 minutes.

name: Pancakes
directions:
Overnight: 2 cups of warm water. (105 F) 
Dissolve 1 small packet of Fleishman's yeast 
Mix in 2 cups of white flour

Cover overnight.

Next morning, add
1 T. sugar 
1 t. salt
2 eggs
1/2 t. baking soda

name: Peanut Butter Cookies
directions:
1 pkg Duncan Hines yellow cake mix
1 cup peanut butter
1/2 c. cooking oil 
2 tablespoons water
2 eggs

Preheat oven to 350

Combine ingredients and mix well. Drop from t. onto ungreased baking sheet. Press 2 crisscross on each cookie with fork prongs that you have dipped in water.

Bake at 350 for 10-12 minutes until golden. Cool on rack for 1 minute, then remove.

name: Philadelphia Soft Pretzels
directions:
1 c. warm water
2 pkgs active dry yeast
2 T. sugar
3 c. all-purpose flour 
2 t. baking soda
butter or shortening 
1 egg 
coarse salt (kosher salt)

Put the cup of very warm water into the mixing bowl and add the yeast. Stir until the yeast is completely dissolved

Add the sugar and stir. Gradually add the flour and stir. Knead the dough for about 5 minutes and form into a ball.

Let rise in a warm, dark place for at least 30 minutes until double. While dough is rising, heat the oven to 400 fill the pot half full of water, add the baking soda and bring the water to a slow boil. Crease or butter the cookie sheet.

Roll out the dough onto approximate square about 1/4 to 1/16 inch thick. Cut the dough about as wide as your finger. Twist each strip into a pretzel shape and one at a time lower into the boiling water for five to ten seconds.

Place on cookie sheet and coat with a beaten egg. Sprinkle with salt. Bake the pretzels for about 12 -15 minutes or until golden brown.

name: Pigs in a Blanket
directions:
2 lbs. ground chuck 
3/4 ground pork or pork sausage
2/3 cup rice
1 egg 
1/4 cup onion,

(Brown rice and onion in a little oil)

Boil 2 heads cabbage for 15 minutes so leaves can be taken off easily/ Roll meat in leaves and cook in a large pot--to which has been added 1 can of tomatoes and 1-12 cans water of tomato soup.

Cook for 1 1/2 hours. Also can be baked in oven 325 for 1 1/2 hours.

name: Pineapple Cheesecake
directions:
Crust:
2 cups vanilla wafer crumbs 
6 T. butter, softened

Combine wafer crumbs and butter until well blended. Reserve 1/2 cup for topping and press the remaining mixture in bottom of a 9-inch square dish. 

Filling:
2 cups cottage cheese, sieved
1 (8 oz.) package cream cheese.
2 teaspoons vanilla
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 1/2 cups (20 oz. can) crushed pineapple
2 T (2 envelopes) unflavored gelatin
3 egg yolks, slightly beaten 
3/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup milk
3 egg whites

Combine cottage cheese, cream cheese vanilla and salt. Drain pineapple; sprinkle gelatin over pineapple sirup to soften. In a saucepan, combine egg yolks sugar and milk. Cook, stirring constantly until thickened. Stir in gelatin until dissolved. Remove from heat and cool slightly. Stir in cottage cheese mixture and 1 cup of the pineapple. Beat egg whites until stiff but not dry; then fold in the cheese mixture, Pour into prepared dish, sprinkle on reserved crumb mixture and chill overnight. Cut into squares and makes 9 to 12 servings.

name: Pineapple upside Down Cake
directions:
3 T. butter
1 cup brown sugar
1 can crushed pineapple (drained, but save for other)
Mix sugar + butter + melt.

Cake Batter:
1 cup sugar
1 t. vanilla
 1 1/2 c. flour
3 eggs
1/2 cup juice from pineapple
1 1/2 t. baking powder

Beat eggs, mix sugar with eggs. Then add pineapple juice + vanilla. Add flour, baking powder, and beat well.

Put crushed pineapple over melted butter + brown sugar. Pour batter over this. Bake 45 mins at 350°

name: Quiche au Fromage de Gruyere
directions:
6-8 slices bacon, medium thickness
1 quart (4 cups) water 
8-inch partially cooked pastry shell, placed on a baking sheet
3 eggs 
1 1/2 - 2 cups milk
1 cup swiss cheese 
1/2 tsp. salt. 
2 T. butter cut into pea-sized dots
pinch of pepper
pinch of nutmeg

Preheat oven to 375. Cut bacon into pieces an inch thick. Simmer for 5 minutes in the water. Rinse in cold water. Dry on paper towels. Brown slightly in a skillet. Press bacon pieces into bottom of shell. Beat the eggs, milk, and cheese, and seasonings in a mixing bowl until blended. Pour into the pastry shell and put the butter pieces or top. 

Set in the upper half of the oven and bake for 25 minutes, or until top of Quiche has puffed and browned.

name: Ramos Fizz
directions:
1 tsp. lemon juice 
1 heaping tsp. granulated sugar
2 oz. half and half
1 egg white
1 1/4 oz. gin
2 drops orange flower water
2 oz. soda just before blender.

(For 4 use 1 bottle club soda)

name: Raw Vegetable Dip
directions:
In choosing your vegetables, mix the conventional (celery, carrots, onions) with the adventuresome (raw sliced turnips, sweet red onion wedges, zucchini sticks). 

1/4 pound blue cheese 
½ large (8oz.) package cream cheese 
3 tablespoons dry vermouth
1 small clove garlic, mashed or minced 
Commercial sour cream 

Combine the blue cheese, cream cheese, vermouth, and garlic. Add enough sour cream to make mixture thin enough for dunking the vegetables.

name: Refrigerator Cookies
directions:
4 cups sifted cake flour. 
2 1/2 t. baking powder
3/4 t. salt 
2/3 c. butter or margarine
1 1/2 c. sugar
2 eggs
1 t. vanilla or 4 t. milk

Sift together flour, baking powder and salt. Soften butter and mix with sugar, eggs, and vanilla until creamy. Add flour mixture alternately with milk. Chill. On a lightly floured surface, roll half or third of dough. at a time, keeping rest chilled. Roll to " thickness and cut into desired shapes. Place on lightly greased cocky sheet. Bake at 400 degrees 8 to 10 minutes or until delicately browned. (2 dozen large cookies.)

name: Rhubarb Cream Pie
directions:
4 cups rhubarb (cut in inch pieces)
3/4 c. sugar 

Combine together.

Make custard: 
2 eggs, well beaten.
1/2 c. sugar
2 T. butter or margarine
2 T. flour

Pour over rhubarb after you put the rhubarb in an unbaked pie crust.
Bake 1 hr. or more at 350.

name: Roquefort Dressing
directions:
1 c. blue cheese 
1 c. sour cream
1 c. mayonnaise
1 c. cottage cheese (small curd)
1/2 c. buttermilk 
1 T. wine vinegar
1 t. Worcestershire sauce
1/4 t. cayenne pepper 
1 pinch garlic powder
salt to taste

Grind blue cheese medium and add all ingredients together. If too thick, thin down with a bit of milk. Makes 1 qt

name: Rum Cake
directions:
1 c. chopped pecans or walnuts 
1 18 1/2 yellow cake mix
1 33/4 Oz. instant vanilla pudding
4 eggs
1/2 c. cold water
1/2 c. oil or butter.
1/2 c. dark rum

Glaze:
1/4 lb. butter 
1/4 c. water
1 c. sugar
1/2 c. dark rum

Preheat oven to 325 grease and flour 10" tube or 12 c. Bundt. Sprinkle nuts over bottom of the pan. Mix cake ingredients. Pour over nuts. Bake 1 hour. Cool. Invert on serving plate, prick top. Drizzle and smooth glaze evenly over top and sides. Repeat until the glaze is used up/

Glaze:

Melt butter in saucepan. Add water and sugar. Boil 5 minutes stirring constantly. Remove from heat. Stir in rum.

Optional: Decorate with Maraschino cherries and border of sugar frosting of whipped cream. Serve with seedless grapes dusted with powdered sugar.

Age four days before eating, covered securely.

name: Salad
directions:
1 can artichoke hearts 
1 can Del Monte whole beans (drained) 
1 basket tomatoes (small) 

Pour on oil Wine vinegar Clove garlic toss with salt and pepper 

1 can sliced mushrooms 
1 c. chopped parsley

name: Salmon Wellington
directions:
In the book American Gourmet, Jane and Michael Stern describe beef Wellington as a "lardaceous dish" that is "rich beyond reason." The pastry-wrapped beef was the ultimate in dinner-party fare in the sixties. In our recreation, salmon fillets cook in frozen puff pastry sheets, which arrived in the seventies.

1 17.3-ounce package frozen puff pastry (2 sheets), thawed 
4 3/4-inch-thick 6-ounce skinless salmon fillets
6 tablespoons minced shallots 
4 tablespoons plus 2 teaspoons chopped fresh tarragon
1 egg beaten to blend (for glaze)

1/2 cup dry white wine
1/2 cup white wine vinegar 
1/2 cup (1 stick) chilled butter, diced

Preheat oven to 425°F. Roll out each pastry sheet on lightly floured surface to 12-inch square. Cut each in half, forming four 12x6-inch rectangles. Place I salmon fillet in center of each rectangle, about 3 inches in from and parallel to 1 short edge. Sprinkle each fillet with salt, pepper, I tablespoon shallots and 1 tablespoon tarragon. Brush edges of rectangles with some glaze. Fold long sides of pastry over fillets. Fold short edge of pastry over fillets and roll up pastry, enclosing fillets. Seal edges of pastry. Place pastries, seam side down, on king sheet. Brush with glaze. Bake pastries until dough is golden brown, about 20 minutes. Remove from oven; let stand 10 minutes.

Meanwhile, boil wine, vinegar and 2 tablespoons shallots in heavy small saucepan until liquid is reduced to 6

tablespoons, about 8 minutes. Remove pan from heat. Add butter piece at a time, whisking until melted before adding next piece. Whisk in 2 teaspoons tarragon. Season sauce with salt and pepper. Cut pastries into thirds. Place sauce and pastries on 4 plates.

Makes 4 servings.

name: Shish-Kabob
directions:
1/3 cup Worcestershire
1/2 cup olive oil
1/2 cup Mazola
white wine
lemon juice (2 lemons) Tarragon + cider vinegar--more(??!!)
1 tsp. curry
salt
12 pepper corns
onions
garlic salt 
bay leaf--marinate.

Cook and brown for about 10 minutes in broiler or outside BBQ. Serve with peppers, mushrooms, onions, tomatoes, etc.

name: Sloppy Joes
directions:
1 lb. hamburger
1/4 c. celery (chopped)
1/2 green pepper 
1 med. chopped onion
1 can tomato soup 
1 can water

Brown hamburger, add onion and green pepper, sauté. Add soup, water, celery and cook for 1 hour.

name: Soda Bread
directions:
3. c flour
1 t. Salt
1/2 c. sugar.
3 t. baking powder 
1/2 t. soda
1 cup raisins
1 egg
1 cup buttermilk

375°- 1/2 hour, then to 325°
Brush top with margarine.

name: Soda Bread
directions:
3 cups All Bran
3 cups White Four
1 t. baking soda + 1 t. baking powder
1/2 t. salt
caraway seeds
1 pt. buttermilk

Bake at 350 degrees for one hour.

name: Spice Bars
directions:
Cream:
1/2 c. shortening
1 egg
2 c. flour
1 t. soda

Combine the following and bring to rapid boil:

1 c. sugar
1 c. water
1 c. raisins
1 t. salt
1 t. cinnamon
1/4 t. nutmeg
1/4 t. cloves

Cook for 2 min and then cool.

Add to the egg-butter mixture and mix well. Pour into a greased 9x15 inch pan. Bake at 350 degrees for 25 minutes.

Ice with butter icing while warm or sprinkle with powdered sugar.

Icing:
2 T. soft butter.
2 T. powdered sugar

Mix well add more powd. sugar
with warm milk.
Drop of vanilla
Orange juice

name: Spice Cookies
directions:
Mix:

3/4 c. shortening.
1 c. sugar 
1 egg, unbeaten.
1/4 c. molasses.

Then sift together and stir in
2 c. flour
2 tsp. soda
1 tsp. cinnamon 
3/4 tsp. powdered cloves.
3/4 tsp. powdered ginger

Fix it all together and form into walnut sized balls. Put 2" apart on greased cooky sheet and bake at 375 for 10-12 minutes.

name: Spinach Lasagna
directions:
One 12 oz. pk. Lasagna noodles
2 T. olive oil 
1 medium onion, chopped 
1/2 Green pepper, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced or pressed
1 (16 oz) can tomato paste
1 (1 lb. 13 oz) can tomatoes 
1/4 c. fresh chopped parsley
1 T. dry Oregano 
1 bay leaf
pinch of dry chili pepper flakes 
1 (10 oz.) pkg frozen chopped spinach, cooked 
12 oz. Ricotta or cottage cheese 
1 egg 
2 T. grated parmesan cheese
1 t. salt
1/4 t. pepper
6 or 8 oz. slices Mozzarella cheese 
3/4 c. grated Parmesan cheese

Cook lasagna noodles according to package directions (about 15 minutes) Drain and rinse with cold water. Set aside. Heat olive oil, and add onion, green pepper, and garlic; sauté until golden brown, about 5 minutes. Stir in tomato paste, tomatoes, parsley, oregano, bay leaf, salt and chili pepper flakes.

Simmer uncovered about 30 minutes. Combine drained cooked spinach, ricotta. egg, 2 T. parmesan, salt and pepper. Spoon 1/3 of tomato sauce into bottom of a 9 x 13 baking dish. Cover with a layer c of noodles, half of Ricotta filling, half of Mozzarella and half of the remaining Parmesan cheese.

Repeat layers using another 1/3 of sauce, and remaining noodles, ricotta filling and mozzarella. Top with remaining sauce and Parmesan cheese. Bake in a preheated 350 degree oven for 30 to 40 minutes.

8 serving

name: Spinach Soup
directions:
4 cups broth from corned beef 
1 bay leaf 
3 or 4 cinnamon sticks 
red hot chilies 
1/2 tsp of coriander,allspice, and mustard seed 
1 onion 

Cook corned beef in all of the above
2 pkg frozen spinach 
1 cup sour cream 

Blend in blender.

name: Stayabed Stew
directions:
Mix in a casserole dish with a tight lid:

2 lbs. beef stew meat cubed 
*1 can little peas
1 c. sliced carrots
2 chopped onions 
1 t. salt
dash of pepper
1 can of cream of tomato soup thinned with can water (may use celery or mushroom soup)
1 large potato, sliced
*piece of bay leaf

(* These may be omitted.) 

Put in a 275 oven and let cook happily for 5 hours.

name: Steamed Vegetable Salad with Lemon Dill Dressing
directions:
4 t. lemon juice.
1/4 c. + 1 T. virgin olive oil. 
2 t. chopped fresh dill
pinch grated nutmeg
salt and pepper to taste
7 or 8 baby carrots, peeled, split lengthwise
1/2 head broccoli, broken into bite-size florets
1/4 head cauliflower, broken into bite-sized florets 
6 small cherry tomatoes
8 small whole mushrooms

Whisk the lemon juice with the olive oil in a small bowl until the dressing thickens. Add the chopped dill weed, nutmeg, salt and pepper. Whisk to blend. Set aside. Select a plate or platter that will hold the vegetables in a single layer and a skillet just large enough to support the plate on its rim. Arrange the vegetables attractively on the plate. Place the carrots, broccoli and cauliflower closer to the rim of the plate and the tomatoes and mushrooms more toward the center. Sprinkle the vegetables with salt and pepper. Cover the platter with foil a large pot lid or another platter of the same size. Fill the skillet with an inch or two of water and bring to a boil. Place the prepared platter on top of the skilled of simmering water and steam for about 10 minutes, or until the carrots are just tender.

Remove the platter from the steam and uncover. Four any juices that have accumulated on the plate into the dill dressing. Whisk the dressing to make smooth and thick; pour over the veg. Serve hot. Yields 4 side servings, 2 entree servings.

name: Stuffed Mushrooms
directions:
1/2 lb. sausage meat
1 tsp. grated onion
1/4 cup breadcrumbs.
1/2 tsp. salt 
1/2 tsp. pepper

Wash 18 large fresh mushrooms, dry and remove the stems. Chop stems finely and stir into the sausage mixture. Form into balls and place in mushroom caps. Arrange mushrooms in baking dish (pie pan) and bake at 350 for 20 minutes

name: Swedish Meatballs
directions:
1/2 lb. ground beef 
1/2 lb. ground pork
1/2 lb. ground veal
2 cups soft whole wheat breadcrumbs --cubed
1/2 cup milk
1 onion peeled and finely chopped
10 T butter. 
2 tsp. salt
2 tsp. paprika 
1 tsp. poultry seasoning 
1 tsp. dry mustard
4 tsp. pepper
3 eggs, beaten. 
1/4 cup flour
1 T, tomato paste 
1 can (10 1/2 oz.) condensed beef bouillon
1 cup commercial sour cream

Have your butcher grind beef, pork, and veal together twice. Soak bread cubes in mild. Squeeze dry and add to beef, pork and veal. Add onion which has been painted in 2 T butter, salt paprika, poultry seasoning, mustard, pepper and eggs. Mix well. Form into about 100 small balls. Brown meatballs in a skillet, a portion at a time, using 1/2 cup butter. As they are browned, transfer them to a bowl. When all meat balls are browned, stir the flour into the pan drippings. Blend in tomato paste and bouillon mixed with enough water to make 2 1/4 cups. Stir over low heat until sauce is thickened. Put the meat balls back and heat for a few minutes. Just before serving stir in the sour cream, blending well. 

Makes 12 servings.

name: Sweet Potato Muffins
directions:
2 fresh eggs
1 c. milk
1 stick butter
1 1/4 c. granulated sugar 
1 1/2 c. all-purpose flour
1 1/2 c. sweet potatoes, mashed
2 t. baking powder
1 t. cinnamon
1/4 t. nutmeg 
1/4 t. salt
1/2 c. raisins
1/4 c. pecans or walnuts, chopped

Have all ingredients at room temperature.

Cream butter and sugar and sweet potatoes until smooth.
Add eggs. Blend all four ingredients well.

Sift flour, baking powder and spices and add alternately with milk to the egg batter. Do not overmix. Feld in nuts and raisins last. Sprinkle a little cinnamon-sugar on the top before baking. Bake in a greased muffin tin at 400-degrees F. for approx. 25 minutes or until done.

You should get about 2 dozen small muffins from the above batch. Muffins can be frozen and reheated.

name: Tabouleh
directions:
2 cups bulgur (cracked wheat)
3 1/2 cups chopped parsley 
1 c. chopped fresh mint or 1/4 c. dried mint, crumbled
1/2 c. finely chopped green onion
1/4 c. finely chopped yellow onion
2 large ripe tomatoes, chopped 
2/3 c. fresh lemon juice
1/2 c. olive oil
1 - 2 t. salt 
1/8 t. white pepper
Dash ground cinnamon

1. Wash bulgur. Place in large bowl. Add enough hot water to cover. Let stand 40 minutes. Drain thoroughly in a colander. Squeeze dry with hands. 
2. Combine the bulgur, parsley, mint, green onion, yellow onion and tomatoes in a large bowl. 
3. Whisk together the lemon juice, olive oil, salt and cinnamon in a 2-cup glass measure. Gently stir until well blended. Serve on a bed of lettuce, or with endive leaves for scooping, or on half a papaya (with seeds removed).

Note: To prepare the tabbouleh 1 to 2 hours ahead, mix all the ingredients together, except the tomato and the oil. Refrigerate, covered. To serve, gently mix in the tomato and oil until well blended.

Makes 8 servings

name: Tahini
directions:
8 big spoons of plain tahini (Tahini oil)
garlic
salt
lemon juice
parsley flakes

Stir the tahini in a bowl and while stirring add some lemon juice slowly (by that the tahini have two changes: first of all it becomes thin and change its color to white) until the taste is sour enough. 
Add water until it's thin enough, add the garlic, parsley and salt. 
In the end, put on the top some hot paprika and black pepper

name: Tarragon Chicken Casserole
directions:
Serves 4 to 6.

In a rectangular baking pan arrange the cut pieces of 2 1/2 to 3 lbs. broiler chicken, skin side up, do not overlap pieces. Chop 1 or 2 medium sized onions and scatter over chicken along with 1 1/2 t. tarragon, 1/4 t. poultry seasoning, 1 1/4t. salt, 1/4 t. pepper. Mix one can (10 1/2 oz.) cream of chicken soup with 1/4 c. milk and spoon over chicken.

Bake in a moderately hot oven. (375) for 40 min. Sprinkle chicken with about c. sliced or slivered almonds, if desired. Bake 10 minutes more or until chicken is tender

name: Turkey Marsala
directions:
Thin slices cut in small pieces (can pound dices but not necessary) 

Toss with flour, salt and pepper Frown in butter (or oil) -- some garlic in butter first,

Add 1/3 to 1/2 cup each beef bouillon or stock marsala 

Scrape up bits and simmer for 10 minutes (plus).

name: Turkey Stuffing
directions:
1 cup breadcrumbs
2 eggs
1/2 t. cinnamon, allspice and sage (each) 
1 c. of corn for popping 
1/2 c. milk

Rub inside of turkey with garlic and end of cut lemon. Mix all of the ingredients above together until well mixed. Stuff loosely into cavity. Cover bird with aluminum foil and set on top shelf of oven. Set at 400. Lift foil frequently and baste, but keep out of the way of the turkey because as soon as the corn starts to pop, it will blow the turkey's ass halfway across the room.

name: Ukranian Poppy Seed Cake
directions:
3/4 cup poppy seeds
3/4 cup milk
3/4 cup shortening
1 cup sugar
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups sifted flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
3 eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla

Soak the poppy seeds in milk 5 to 6 hours. Cream shortening and sugar. Add 1 egg yolk at a time and beat well after each addition. Add vanilla, milk with poppy seeds, then flour sifted together with baking powder and salt. Mix well. egg whites beaten stiffly. Add Bake at 375 degrees about 30 to 40 (50) minutes in 9" tube pan."

Note: This recipe is from Mary Reed Newland's The Year and Our Children: "...a special poppy seed cake which is traditional with the Ukrainians at both Easter and Christmas time. So far the only reason suggested for its infrequent appearance is that perhaps poppy seeds were expensive or hard to find, and thus were saved for great feasts....We like to bake the poppy seed cake for Easter because it reminds us of the whole lesson of Lent, the seed thrust into the ground to die, that it might live. We have this recipe from a Ukrainian lady....The circle of the cake, baked in the tube pan, is like the circle of eternity--and that is the point of death to self: to live forever."

You may sift powdered sugar over it, or ice it with a thin confectioner's sugar icing, or serve it plain. It is nice plain, rather like a pound cake.

name: Veal and Noodles
directions:
2 T. butter or marg. 
2 medium-sized veal cutlets, cut in strips
1 clove garlic, minced or mashed 
1/2 t. salt
dash pepper 
1/4 t. rosemary (opt.) or tarragon, marjoram, basil or summer savory
1/4 c. water c. sour cream
1/2 t. paprika
1 1/2 c. cooked noodles.

Melt butter or margarine over medium heat (electric fry 400)
Put in veal; sprinkle with garlic, salt, pepper, and rosemary. Brown quickly on both sides (about 4 to 5 min. total). Reduce heat, add water, cover and simmer for 30-45 minutes. or until meat is very tender. Turn off heat; stir in sour cream paprika, noodles, cover pan and leave over heat for just a few minutes until mixture is heated enough. Serve immediately. You might sprinkle each serving with paprika. 

Makes 2 servings.

name: Veal Pocket
directions:
1 veal breast with pocket (2 lbs.)

Stuffing:
4 slices stale bread
1/2 lb. ground pork
3 eggs
1 T. chopped parsley
salt and pepper
1/2 chopped onion

Stuff; nails (4); bake at least 2 hours. Cover then uncover 1/2 hour. 350.

Good with cranberry sauce.

name: Vernie's Chili
directions:
1 lb. ground beef
1 1g. onion 
1 green pepper

Cook until tender.

Add:
2 cans kidney beans
2 cans tomato soup
1 can water 
1 t. chili powder
1 t. salt 

Cook slowly 1 1/2 hours (simmer)

name: Welsh Rarbbit (Rabbit)
directions:
? T butter
1 lb. sharp Cheddar cheese, shredded 
1/2 tsp. dry mustard
dash cayenne
1/2 tsp. salt 
1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce.
1/2 cup beer
2 eggs, slightly beaten
8 slices toast
parsley

Mix butter in top pan double boiler over direct heat. Add cheese and heat stirring til melted. Pour over boiling water; add seasoning and pour in beer mixed and add eggs. Cook til smooth and thick, stirring frequently. Serve on toast, garnish with parsley. (If too thick add more beer)

name: White Bread
directions:
Proof yeast:
1 pkg yeast w/ 1 T. sugar and 1/4 c. warm water

Combine
3 c. flour w/ 1 T. salt

Add yeast mixture and 1 c. warm water. stir.

Knead and let rise for 2 1/2 hours -- or until doubled.

Punch and divide into 1 large or two small pans. Let rise another hour. Brush the loaf w/ 1 T. water and 1 egg white and bake in a 400 oven for 35-45 minutes (until brown and hollow).

Makes 1 loaf

name: Whole Wheat Quick Bread
directions:
Sift into a bowl:

2 c. whole wheat flour
1 t. baking soda
2 t. baking powder
1 t. salt

Add:
1/2 c. soy flour 
6 T. corn oil
1 1/3 c. sour milk (1 c. milk w/ 2 t. vinegar)
1/2 c. molasses (or honey) 
1/4 c. wheat germ
1/4 c. instant dry milk

Stir well. Spoon into buttered 9x5 loaf pan. Let stand for 20 minutes. Bake for 35 minutes, or until bread is nicely browned and tests dry with a toothpick. A lovely bread especially for breakfast.

name: Wine Cake
directions:
1 box cake mix (yellow) 
1 3oz. instant vanilla pudding
4 eggs
3/4 c. sherry wine.
3/4 cup salad oil
1 tsp. salad oil 
1 tsp. cinnamon.
1 tsp. nutmeg

Combine all ingredients in mixer bowl, blend. then beat at high speed for 5 min. Grease a tube or Bundt pan (grease well) Bake at 350 for 50-60 minutes. Cool in pan for 15 minutes. Turn out on rack.

name: XMas Pineapple Cookies
directions:
4 cups flour
1 lb. Oleo
1/2 pt. sour cream
pineapple preserves

Cut Oleo into flour--add sour cream.

Mix these 3 ingredients like pie crust. Then roll into a ball. Refrigerate overnight.

Roll out like pie crust on powdered sugar and cut into 2 in. squares. Pineapple preserves are used for silling.

Place about 1/2 t. - t. on each square. Fold two opposite corners to the center and pinch together. Place on ungreased cookie sheet.

Bake 15 minutes or until lightly browned at 350.

Makes 3 dozen!

name: Yogurt
directions:
1. Mix 2 t. unflavored gelatin with 1 cup boiling water. Add 1 T. sugar or honey.
2. Turn on oven to 270.
3. Mix 3 cups powdered milk with 2 cups water.
4. Add 1 large can evaporated milk
5. Add 1 cups water.
6. Add 3 T. yogurt.
7. Then add gelatin.
8. Turn off oven. Put in oven covered. Do not disturb. Let set for 8-10 hours in oven.

Makes 2 quarts

name: Zucchini Bread
directions:
3 eggs, beaten 1 c. oil
2 c. sugar (usually less if doubled, use 3 c.)
2 c. grated zucchini
3 tsp. vanilla
3 c. sifted flour 1 t. salt
1 t. baking soda t. baking powder
3 t. cinnamon
nuts if desired

Mix in order given and bake in 2 9x5 inch baking pans for an hour in a 350 oven. Makes 2 loaves.
